meanings.definition: A soft wax or grease used to waterproof leather.
meanings.sent1: The shoemaker applied dubbin to the leather boots to protect them from water.
meanings.sent2: She bought a tin of dubbin to maintain the quality of her leather bag.
meanings.sent3: The dubbin made the leather shoes so shiny that they reflected the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The dubbin acted like a shield, guarding the leather from any moisture.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the dubbin lingered in the room long after the shoes were treated.

meanings.sent1: He would carefully dubbin the saddle to keep it in good condition.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler will dubbin the new shoes before giving them to the customer.
meanings.sent3: She playfully dubbed the dubbin as the 'magic potion' for leather goods.
meanings.sent4: With each stroke, he dubbined the leather, renewing its strength.
meanings.sent5: The way she dubbined the leather showed her expertise in shoe care.

meanings.definition: A mixture of tallow and oil used for greasing leather.
meanings.sent1: The old recipe called for a specific ratio of tallow and oil to make the dubbin.
meanings.sent2: The leatherworker always kept a jar of dubbin handy in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The dubbin smelled so good that it tempted the dog to chew on the leather goods.
meanings.sent4: The dubbin was like a secret potion that kept the leather supple and strong.
meanings.sent5: Applying the dubbin was a ritual that ensured the longevity of the leather products.
